reviews.text: Incredible! The jollof rice and yams were delectable. The goat curry is one of the best dishes I have had in my LIFE. Went with a group and we adored it!

I bought egusi soup with fufu $28 something. I asked for mixed meats they gave me bones of goat meat! They were not meat on theses bones AT ALL. But that is not my concern bcs sometimes, it‚Äôs can happen. The most scary part is that I feel like it‚Äôs the rest of someone food that they gave it to me bcs the way there was no meat on the bone is like someone did it intentionally! I‚Äôm so disappointed and confused.

The restaurant delivers quality dishes with nice service. The staff focused on assisting me first and responded to my inquiries with genuine courtesy. Waiters delivered great service with inventive food options. This establishment offers a good atmosphere. I'll return to this restaurant without delay!
Phenomenal! The red stew with chicken was my favorite! Everything was seasoned to perfection.

The food here is great. Soup is flavorful and the assorted meats so far have been a hit every time.   Service is below average but at least they‚Äôre not rude like every other Nigerian restaurant I‚Äôve been to. It‚Äôs a new restaurant so I hope it doesn‚Äôt go downhill once it becomes more popular. I would definitely recommend as I‚Äôve tried the food several times already!

I have only ordered delivery from this restaurant so I can only speak on the food. The low star rating seems unfair so I wanted to share my experience. My regular orders are jollof rice with turkey, egusi or vegetable soup with mixed meats, and the mixed meat stew that‚Äôs in a dark red sauce. I usually get the regular fufu (pounded yam) to go with the soup or stews. Can‚Äôt go wrong with any of those items. The jollof rice is fresh, beady, flavorful, and best of all not dry! It‚Äôs my favorite thing to order here.

The food was very great! I enjoyed the experience and it seemed to get lots of orders and the wait wasn‚Äôt that bad. The food in my opinion was very good but for the price I feel I could‚Äôve had more. The Egusi soup was $25 but I felt there could‚Äôve been a little more and the Jollof Rice with lamb was $20 which I think was worth the price. Though I believe these portions are quite good for one person. The flavors were amazing with a nice burst in your mouth and tasted nice and smoky. The goat could‚Äôve been a bit more tender but the sauce over it was amazingly top tier. I with I could‚Äôve smothered my Jollof rice in it too. I would definitely come here again despite it being a whole hour away.

I absolutely love Wakkys African Restaurant! Every dish I‚Äôve tried has been nothing short of amazing, and my husband swears by their jollof rice, he won‚Äôt eat it from anywhere else lol. The flavors are always on point, and the quality is consistent. Egusi, Ogbono, ayamase and stew rice, okra soup!! Everything.
The only downside is the recent change to the meat pies. Whoever tweaked the recipe, please bring back the ORIGINAL ! The old version had the perfect taste and was honestly unbeatable. Still, this place is hands down one of my favorites in Brooklyn. GET THE OLD MEATPIES!! ‚Ä¶you‚Äôll thank me later!

I enjoyed the flavors from first bite to last. This spot deserves recognition beyond current options. This spot caters to people who want the best without overpaying. Their staff delivered prompt, friendly attention that my family would appreciate. This spot is REMARKABLE!

Their meals combine classic and new flavors while service remains exceptional. Despite the crowds, waitstaff stayed efficient and the vibe stayed comfortable. The staff's demeanor adds to the overall experience. The menu offers flavor diversity. Each aspect of the meal was delightful.

My first experience at D. Salam surly wii not be my last. I had an amazing and meaningful experience especially to find out that the woman who prepared the meals prepared them on her own for the day and although there were supposed to be other cooks to help her out there she'd been the only one to take on the responsibility. I enjoyed the music selection while waiting on my meal to be prepared. I also had the opportunity to watch the one coworker that did attend prepare Sorel for the fridge and happened to receive a complimentary bottle withy meal. The food had been amazing. It's a must try
The staff is so friendly and the food is soooo freshhhh!!! They have art for sale, live music, a Jamaican AND Senegalese chefs here! It‚Äôs amazing place!

A good option that won't disappoint. The team balanced quickness, thoroughness, warmth and protocol. It's obvious they don't skimp on food quality. This place has created the perfect vibe. I consider myself fortunate to have found this spot.

Delicious cuisine! I tried the Jollof rice and the mafe (peanut butter sauce)... absolutely fantastic! The staff were wonderful, and the service was top-notch. I‚Äôll definitely return. There‚Äôs truly nothing like enjoying authentic African dishes in your own neighborhood.

This place serves food worth traveling for, and the neighborhood makes the trip worthwhile. These employees are quick-thinking yet never condescending. Each course was better than expected. I appreciated the dining experience. D. Salam African Cuisine shows unwavering quality.

Lalibela Ethiopian Restaurant deserves its flowers. Five years strong ‚Äî that‚Äôs something worth celebrating, especially for a spot that made it through the pandemic and came out thriving. Every time I‚Äôve passed by or stepped in, it‚Äôs full of life ‚Äî never empty, always welcoming, always consistent.

The service is warm, the energy is good, and you can tell people come here because it feels like home. The chef recommends the Lamb Awaze Tibs, and while I haven‚Äôt tried it myself (Uber driver pick-up life), I‚Äôve seen enough satisfied faces to know it‚Äôs the real deal.

Shout-out to the whole Lalibela team for five solid years of culture, community, and flavor holding down Harlem. Keep shining ‚Äî y‚Äôall built something special.

Flavors that last. Community that matters.

The absolute best gluten free restaurant experience I have had in New York until this day!

And I cost me only $24. It is absurdly cheap. I will be tipping extra just because the food should be priced higher for such amazing quality!!!

HOW am I discovering Ethiopian food like this is naturally gluten free.

Huge portions! The picture doesn‚Äôt show how much food you truly get!
I am moving away from this neighborhood next week, but I just found this place üò≠
Absolutely delicious and reasonably priced food. Every time I went most of the other patrons were Ethiopian - this is always a good sign for authenticity.
Lalibela sampler is delicious!!!  Tibs wot best ive ever had.  Large portion for the price too.   Finally, nice dining room, washroom all immaculate.

My first time there created a lasting impression. The flavors blend nicely. The staff demonstrates excellent customer care and genuine value for what they sell. This restaurant works well for group dining and offers a relaxed atmosphere. Would totally come back again.. in a heartbeat actually.
I went into Foua African Market looking for a specific West African spice (sumbala mugu). I was thrilled that they carry this at a reasonable price. The service was fast, pleasant, and easy!

Woman that owns the shop was very helpful and kind. It's a small shop, as most african markets I've been to are, yet had a variety of foods which is appreciated. I even found foods I missed from home that I haven't found elsewhere.

I got a parking space. I was able to buy west african soup ingredients n drinks at affordable prices at a spot. The man that attended to me was really helpful. I was also allowed to use ATM for the items purchased at no cost. I will definitely come again.

Foua African Market is a very clean store. The food are very fresh. There‚Äôs a Natural Product call LA PAIX is very very good for Men to make love. The workers are nice and polite. Be Blessed. Thanks üôè

Their store hours listed is optional. They open when they want and close when they want.

It‚Äôs 11AM on a Monday & they are closed and they‚Äôre suppose to be open. Same for this past weekend. I need to find another shop in my neighborhood.

My friends and I were working for six hours straight at a studio nearby and we were starving. Mayowa was around the corner and we‚Äôve never had Nigerian food before so we excited ordered the Suya wrap and the jollof, plantain, & protein combo (we picked chicken).

The wrap was good, but the star of that order were the sweet potatoes that came with it. They were a bit firmer than regular sweet potatoes and came with a delicious spicy sauce that was perfect on every item.

The jollof rice was our favorite. It was rich and seasoned to perfect, with each bite of onion and bell pepper bursting with flavor. Wasn‚Äôt too salty either despite having so much flavor! The plantains had a mild taste and wonderful texture (which paired great with the sweet potato sauce). The chicken was good, a little bit dry but still very enjoyable with the rest of the dish.

When we picked up our order, the gentleman handing our order greeted us with a smile. He also included two hibiscus drinks on the house (most likely due to the extreme heat and humidity) which was greatly appreciated! They tasted wonderful‚Äîlightly sweetened with a soft tartness that chased each sip.

We would definitely return to try other dishes!

I grew up in Nigeria, so I know what real Nigerian food should taste like and this is one of the best I‚Äôve ever had! The beef fried rice was packed with meat (no skimping here!) and bursting with flavor. The beef was tender and juicy, the rice perfectly seasoned. On top of that, the owner is incredibly kind and clearly pours his heart into the food. Highly recommend!

I called and did a pick up order. The owner, Chef Tanto, absolutely knows his way around the kitchen. His food is so flavorful. Upon first bite my mouth was in heaven. Whichever rice you get, make sure you get the sautee√©d peppers & onions to go with it! This stew sauce is incredibly and pairs perfect with the jollof and fried rice.  The plantains are perfect.  The Zobo is delicious. 10/10 ‚≠êÔ∏è

If you‚Äôre a foodie and into delicious flavorful food, go to Mayowa. Your mouth will thank you!

Honestly, if I can give a zero out of 10, I truly would
I had gotten Jollof rice and a Egusi soup it had no flavor. Imaginee??

No taste .

just airy and disgusting truthfully a waste of my money .
I felt like the employee tried to coerce me to give them a best rating, without evening tiring the food.

So as soon as I went home, my ancestors were definitely upset. to be a true Nigerian and to try to other peoples way of serving Nigerian delicacies it was truly a disaster. & over priced to be not even decent
I hope that they can do better
Something needs to be compensated

Thank you.

This is the most disgusting  soup I‚Äôve ever tasted in my life . You can honestly taste no flavor . You guys should be ashamed to consider this as a Nigerian dish. This is a disgrace to the Nigerian culture.  Don‚Äôt waste your money on this rubbish

name: Sunday Tuco G LLC. Nigerian Food
vicinity: 6501 Hollywood Blvd 4345 Degnan Blvd, 700 Warren Ln, Los Angeles

reviews.text: First time trying and it was so good! Will definitely be coming back when in LA.

name: Yordanos Ethiopian Restaurant
vicinity: 4020 W Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Los Angeles

reviews.text: üá™üáπ ETHIOPIA (via Eat the World Los Angeles) - When you arrive at Yordanos in Crenshaw, the exterior does not hint to the joy that you will eventually find inside. But the warmth of the space and the wonderful aromas smack your senses as soon as the door is opened and you take one step past the threshold. The restaurant has the feel of a place that has been around for its community a long time, but in reality the grand opening was in the summer of 2019. Nowadays you will find groups of friends coming to talk with each other over beer, wine, or Ethiopian coffee, or enjoying an NBA game on the TV after finishing a meal.

It was my first Ethiopian restaurant to try and I liked the vibe and food types.
Sabusa is no Brainer try.
I just figured their mild spicy level is not very mild and is strong so be careful before the order.

Wow wow wow. So my friend and I wanted to go on a food adventure and we chose this amazing place.  The first thing that you take in is the atmosphere... peaceful, calming and inviting. Not knowing anything about Ethiopian food, I was wide-eyed and ready for anything. It was far too difficult to pick anything to order with no clue as to what things might be to our taste. So we went with the Mahberawi, an amazing platter with six different items, two very spicy dishes, and 4 other flavorful dishes.  Along with the platter came a bowl of what looked to be a thin bread but more spongy.  I was familiar wnough with ethiopian food from a prior visit that one takes a piece of the injera and scoops up a mouthful portion and enjoy.

... is tomato, spices with onions and ground beef with a tanky flavor. It was very mild and quite tasty.

.... is a bit like carne asada mixed with onion and seasoning which was very satisfying.

... omg the beef with collard greens was amazing. Flavorful and mildly seasoned paired well with the bread.

Yebeg Alicha... the bread, injera, was soaked with beef and seasoning with a tangy flavir.

Kitfo ... was ground steak tartar which will make you spice lovers extremely happy.

... an even spicier chicken and vegetable dish with hard boiled egg.

This dish was a wonderful way to sample such an awesome variety of foods and flavors.  If you have never eaten Ethiopian food, this is a wonderful place to wet your tastebuds.

The best part is that I can't wait to come back and try the vegetarian tray!!  See you soon!

Have never had ethiopian food before but very pleasantly aromatic, spicy, extremely delicious!!! My son had a dish with salmon, jalape√±os and onions called Fish Kitfo that was very good and spicy. I had the lamb tibs called Yebeg Key Wet which was sooooo very good and spicy! Hand food served with traditional injera that they ferment for 3 days. Very very good. Had a small coffee jebena - strong and good!! Highly recommend here!!!!! Thank you for a very enjoyable experience!
We enjoyed the platter that contains  of different food, and loved it! ü•∞ The service was marvelous, and they played really great music videos from Ethiopia.

Very friendly and authentic Ethiopian restaurant. We enjoyed the large vegan sampler, mango drinks, ginger tea, and the "Ethiopian Coffee experience".

It was all tasty and enjoyable, especially chatting with the couple who are the proprietors and cooks.

Felt like we were honored guests at their home.

i love ethiopian food, and i love injera, however, i wish i could actually rate the food but i can‚Äôt because they denied to serve me. i walked in the restaurant at 7:10pm, they close at 8:00pm. they said they won‚Äôt serve me if i want to sit down and eat. they will only give me food if i do takeout l. i was wanting to make a tiktok of my experience being there to promote the restaurant because i was excited to give it a try, but i guess i wont.

I had the vegetarian sampler plate. I was treated with a delicious cinnamon hot tea and a spicy condiment that was out of this world.  This meal was amazingly delicious and the folks inside were very charming and interested. Lucy made me happy tonight.

My first time at this restaurant. I love Ethiopian, came here based on the proximity and reviews.

Overall it was decent. I had 5 star quality Ethiopian food in other restaurants.

We ordered the following items:
1. Lentil samosa - had far better ones in other restaurants, I left it to be honest after a single bite.
2. Veggie combo - great one
3. lamb tibs and doro wot - these items were good and will recommend them.

Disappointed at Lucy Ethiopian. Ordered a variety of dishes (4 to be exact) and only one was slightly enjoyable (tomato fitfit). The rest seemed like they had been sitting around for a while - definitely not fresh. Additionally, the cleanliness and hygiene were very concerning, which added to the overall negative experience. Considering the price point, it felt hurtful. I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're set on just one item on the menu, and even then, be prepared for a higher-than-average price tag.
We ordered Jollof Rice, Fish Pepper soup, Plaintain, Snail, chicken üòãit was quite delicious and very Affordable ‚ù§Ô∏èüíÉ
A comforting and flavorful takeout meal. The egusi with fufu was rich and satisfying, and the Jollof rice was super tasty and well-seasoned.

Not sure why there‚Äôs so many bad reviews, I got the egusi soup with pounded yam and it was excellent, the food was a good size, affordable and tastiest fresh and authentic, had a bit of good spice to it. People keep saying the lady was rude in the front, but I think many of you are very sensitive and expect people to greet you like your at an olive garden and bow down to you. She was direct and polite in my opinion. Again this isn‚Äôt Olive Garden, so wait times for food to be ready might be longer.

I visited this place once and I had high hopes for the food here. To my surprise, the food was not great as I anticipated. I got some fish egusi with pounded yam and plantains, on the side. The egusi had no kind of spice. Another person who went after me asked for spice, but I didn‚Äôt know that was an option. Either way, the egusi was just bland without the tomato puree taste to it, and the portion size is a bit smaller than other places I have visited. Everything else was a fair, the price, the plantain and the pounded yam.

Figured I‚Äôd finally try out some Nigerian food. Started with the Suya, which was super dry and overcooked. Not a big fan of the spices used, definitely the worst thing I had. Next up was the egusi soup which had very little liquid. The pounded yam itself wasn‚Äôt very flavorful but was nice to soak up the melon seed and other ingredients in the egusi. The chicken and goat were both well seasoned, but the goat varied in tenderness. Finally, a side of jollof rice. So much rice, and while it was cold I couldn‚Äôt stop eating it. Very good spice level and super flavorful. Overall, I thought the food was good but was incredibly oily. You could see pools of oil in the egusi and rice. Wish they cut back a little bit since I think the flavors are good enough on their own. With that being said, I probably wouldn‚Äôt come back just due to the sheer amount of oil.

I ordered the Yassa lamb with aloco (sweet plantains) via the Relish app which is what we have at work. It gets delivered to a floor in my building and we pick it up from there. The order was ready by 12:15pm, the temperature was hot. It is very tasty and a very good portion. I will have some reserved for dinner. It is only 4/5 stars because of the packaging. I now make this a crucial criterion in my reviews. But I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to come to the restaurant and order more food!

Visiting from SC. The food was amazing, my first time trying West African food such as this. The fufu was as delicious and sweet and meshed amazingly with the sauce graine. The sauce graine was cooked to perfection with shrimp and beef! Would definitely recommend!

Went for dinner for a birthday celebration. Food did not take long to arrive. Yassa is Senegalese but they serve authentic West African food including Ivory Coast Sauce Graine dish. Although the menu did not state which items were spicy, the spice was not unbearable, especially paired with the Baobab drink (it has dairy). We met the owner who was very welcoming and warm. You could tell the owner pours love into the food.

Photos:
1 - Nem (appetizer) 6 for $12
2 - Thiou Curry with Lamb and Fufu
3 - Sauce Graine with Fufu
4 - Stews Menu
5 - Non-Alcoholic Beverage Menu

I've been a customer of Yassa for approximately 8 years now. I haven't dined in in quite some time but I typcially do 4 catered (Yassa Lamb) orders a year for the past 3/4 years now. Unfortunately this experience does not reflect my previous experiences. The meat temperature was terrible, either too rough or too gummy. And for some strange reason ended having more bones then meat in the pan. I  understand that cooking on a larger scale can be challenging, however that's why everyone don't CATER.... I'm aware there's been staff changes and unfortunately the catering portion has been affectedtremendously. Cannot continue to justify spending $1400 yearly at this establishment. 1/10

The food at Yassa was delicious.  I will definitely go back.  I have to subtract one star for the service and the atmosphere.

Our server was polite, but got my order wrong and the person who brought it out just proceeded to leave it when I informed him.

There was a man there handing out leaflets while we were just trying to enjoy a meal. This impacted the experience and I‚Äôm unsure why the restaurant allowed him to stay and bother patrons.

This is the most disgusting place I have ever gotten food from. The food was in the fridge, who knows how many days old. I saw silver pans of food in a fridge, look like it was cooked elsewhere. I ordered beef and jollof rice. The beef was one big hard bone!! An inedible piece of mystery meat. It looked like a piece of meat they used to put in a stew to ‚Äúflavor‚Äù the dish. I could not take one bite. Please do not buy from here they need to be shut down !!! $18 for bush meat and spicy unflavored rice! Disgusting!!!

In Chi town for a few days, decided to try this place.Ordered on uber eats, the fried rice was 3/10, the goat meat was boiled and stewed , why could you guys not just fry your goat meat so it tastes good. The turkey was one bony piece of turkey for $5:99. You could have just given a descent piece of turkey, but No.
I will say that the moinmoin in the leaf was really nice.That was the best thing from my whole order.
I don‚Äôt know if I would have been served something better if I had dined in.
Overall I was dissatisfied and would try somewhere else next time.

I ordered through Uber Eats and one hour later, the food arrived hot. The plate of Jollof rice with beef and fish was delicious. The beef was soft and flavorful, better than other African restaurants I‚Äôve tried in Chicago. I‚Äôm not a huge fan of the moi moi and plantain. The plantain was not fresh, it seemed microwaved but, I‚Äôll definitely order the Jollof again.

This has quickly become our new favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. On our first visit, the server and owner patiently explained various Nigerian dishes they offer and shared great recommendations. The food was a hit - we have returned multiple times, each visit being equally satisfying.

The pounded yam with Egusi soup was full of flavor and a standout. The cow skin, goat, and beef tripe were all delicious. We also tried the fish roll, beef pattie, and puff puffs, all flavorful and well-prepared.

The server and owner are very friendly and always made us feel welcome. We‚Äôre looking forward to many more visits in the future.
Delicious. Amazing portions. Smells and taste like home! We will definitely come back!had egusi soup with fufu and a meat pie!

Highly do not recommend! My food was not fresh at all, and the service wasn‚Äôt pleasant. I literally had leftovers and old meat that was super hard to chew. They so called reheated as some of the food was still cold and tasted like food that sat in the fridge without being covered. In addition, the spinach soup was barely filled and there were so many tiny bones inside of it. Never again!

Just left 11 minutes ago and I have to say I will be back because I pulled over and ate the whole thing! Delicious food! Family atmosphere and family owned! Thank you and your beautiful family for giving me the best food and experience my first time eating egusi, tripe, and fufu the day before my birthday!

First time here and got the beef Egusi with Amala. It came piping hot, both the Amala and Egusi, but I dug in anyway. Ripping a piece of Amala, roll, and dip. African cuisine is often eaten with your hands, and I like to experience food the way the culture intend it to be. One of the staff was surprised I suggested eating with my hands and asked a bit about me. Guess it's uncommon for non-Africans to eat like Africans here haha

I emptied the bowl and plate, cleaned leftover stew with what's left of my Amala. It was that good. There are other options I should try, and I'll definitely be back to try their other items. Maybe next time I'll take a picture to share

I can‚Äôt believe i bought left over food for 22 dollars so disappointing a friend recommended this restaurant I ordered for beans and plantain take away got home to find out the soup is left over from someone bad restaurant I regret going there p
They have never disappointed me since I started patronizing them. What a sumptuous food! Keep it up

I order from this restaurant once a day and I am completely obsessed. The food is always made hot & fresh and my order is always made within 5 minutes. The meat is plentiful as well, and I always get more food than I can finish. The turkey comes stewed on top and the plantain is soft as well as the rice. I would recommend this place to anyone that lives in Houston as a choice for Nigerian Cuisine. You will not be disappointed.

On two different occasions this business has exhibited unprofessionalism and true lack of customer service.

June 23rd-I‚Äôm extremely disappointed with the experience I had today. I placed a simple food order well before my lunch break, expecting it to arrive in a timely manner. Instead, it took 2.5 hours for the delivery to be completed with no communication or updates about the delay until I reached out myself.
Because of this, I completely missed my lunch break and didn‚Äôt even get to enjoy the food I paid for. To make matters worse, after keeping a customer waiting that long, there was no apology, no complimentary item, or any gesture to make up for the inconvenience. This is unacceptable and shows a clear lack of regard for customers‚Äô time and experience. I hope you take this feedback seriously and improve your communication and service recovery forward.

On August 6th-
I placed an order at 6:35 PM and by 9:46 PM, I still had not received my food. When the DoorDash driver finally arrived, a verbal argument broke out between the driver and a representative from this business. Shockingly, the rep refused to hand over the delivery to the driver ‚Äî but did call me to inform me of the situation.

Despite multiple attempts to contact the business and get an update, I received no clear answers for nearly an hour. This is not just poor customer service ‚Äî it‚Äôs completely unacceptable. I spent over three hours waiting with no resolution. I will not be ordering from here again, and I strongly urge others to think twice before doing so.

So their location online and on Google is a gas station that‚Äôs boarded up and abandoned. This should be corrected. Saying you‚Äôre open on Google and post your hours yet you really don‚Äôt have a location is not only fraudulent but a valuation of the health code. I would stay away from this scam.

Avoid with all cost!! Same as all other reviews!! They take so long to prepare the food that dashers leaveeeeeeeeee. 2 dashers waited for them and left with no food!
I waited over 2 hours for a door dash order! That was never actualized.

If I could leave 0 stars I would, this place accepted my order on DoorDash and had several drivers come to pick up the order (only for them to leave after waiting) with no intentions of fulfilling the order. They never reached out to me or never canceled my order. 3 drivers went and left before I realized an hour and a half had passed, I called them and they lied, saying they reached out to me but I had no incoming or missed calls. They accepted my order knowing that they had no intentions of fulfilling it. Typical!

I‚Äôve always had a soft spot for Ethiopian food, and Desta reminded me exactly why. From the moment I walked in, the warm, aromatic notes of berbere and saut√©ed onions filled the air‚Äîan unmistakable welcome that tells you you‚Äôre in for something special.

The menu itself is thoughtfully designed, guiding you through the experience based on how adventurous you‚Äôre feeling. It‚Äôs the kind of place where first-timers can explore with confidence, and seasoned fans can still find something new to savor. I sampled a few dishes that beautifully balanced earthy lentils, spiced meats, and tangy injera‚Äîthat soft, slightly sour flatbread that ties every bite together. Each dish felt like a conversation between flavor and culture.

Desta delivers not just a meal, but a moment‚Äîone that feels both global and familiar. And now that I‚Äôve discovered there‚Äôs a Desta in Dallas, I can‚Äôt help but wonder if it shares the same spirit as the Atlanta location. Either way, I plan to find out firsthand, fork (or injera) in hand.

10/10 recommend. The food was flavorful, tasty, fresh, and satisfying. It was all my vegan dishes on one plate. We weren't sure what everything was, so the waitress took the time to explain things to us. My go-to was the vegan platter. The mushrooms, lentils, chickpeas‚Äîeverything was excellent! My husband had the grouper, and he said it reminded him of his childhood.

First time here and so happy we chose this spot to try out.  Such good food, flavorful, good portions for the price. Great selection and clear menu how to order.
Mary,  served us and she was wonderful! Very efficient, courteous,  and helpful.  Highly recommend this place

My wife and I showed up and while it.took a moment to get seated because the staff was busy, a table was easily available, even on a Saturday night.
We ordered the Sambusas, Foul, and Vegan Platter. Not only we're all of these very tasty and filling (way too much food for 2 people to finish), but they came out quickly. The staff was courteous and helpful and everything was great. We will definitely come back.

I have been going to Desta‚Äôs since college. Seriously the best Ethiopian I‚Äôve ever tasted. Decided to try Ethiopian brunch and it was even better. 10/10 recommend and soooo happy they have so many locations!

name: Bahel Ethiopian Restaurant
vicinity: 3125 Briarcliff Rd NE ste c, Atlanta

reviews.text: This is my first time trying Ethiopian food. All of us enjoyed the food. The dishes are so delicious and the service is amazing. I wish I can have this everyday. I visited Atlanta from NY and I went to his restaurant twice during my 3 nights stay at GA. That's how much the food was amazing. We got the platter both times and honey wine is also a must try. Sambusa is also very good. Tomato fitfit is also very refreshing. Highly recommended this restaurant ‚ù§Ô∏è

Wow!! Great food. My wife and I stopped by on 6/11/25. The food had a lot of flavor. I had the Kitfo and my wife had the lamb. The food was fresh and tasty. First time eating Ethiopian food, and I will definitely be coming back. The customer service was amazing. You have to try the coffee and the cheese cake to complete your meal.
Excellent service from Hana and Abraham! Food was five stars. Great atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating. They even have a gift shop with souvenirs from Ethiopia.

Its a great vibe with great food. Highly recommend getting the Bahel 3 shareable plate if you're bringing a small party. Recommend getting the honey wine and their iced tea if you love cinnamon. The service is polite and friendly. You will leave happy and nourished.

1st time to an Ethiopian restaurant as I have had similar food but not this exact food. I was welcomed in by the nicest people and they answered every question I had and the food is insanely good and they gave me so much, everything is incredible. Highly recommend! 20/10!

We've been coming to Desta for years. I'm loving the new location. It feels so much cleaner and upscale than the old house.  Injera is such a treat of you've never had it before. One of my favorite types of bread.  Both chicken and steak are delicious and seasoned perfectly.  Can't recommend this place enough. They're always amazing every time we go.

I've been going here since college, as this is one of my favorite restaurants ever. The service is unparalleled - quick, helpful, and very enthusiastic. The ambiance is very welcoming, and there are always so many people (families, groups of friends, etc.) dining in. Plenty of seating, beautiful and lively decor, and - of course - the food is absolutely divine. The Vegan Platter is full of versatile options that feed more than one person, and for the price, you get so much food! 100/10 recommend!
The service here was fantastic. Our waitress was awesome she was very helpful because it was our first time trying Ethiopian food. Everything was delicious.

First time eating here and it was great! I went for dinner with a colleague and we were promptly greeted and seated. The gentleman that was serving us was very attentive ( Forgot to ask for his name) and the food came out super quick but still hot and fresh! will definitely be back

The flavors are just incredible and so unique, featuring a complex yet harmonious blend of aromatic spices that truly elevate the dish. The delicate balance of these spices excites the taste buds with each bite. The ground beef tibs plate, cooked to perfection with a savory, slightly smoky aroma, made me do the ‚Äúsatisfying food dance,‚Äù as I couldn‚Äôt help but enjoy every flavor.

The food was excellent‚Äîfull of flavor with just the right spice level. Prices were a bit on the higher side, but the generous portions made up for it. Overall, I‚Äôd definitely go back and recommend giving this place a try. The only downside was that not everything on the menu was available; I was really looking forward to trying the puff puff and meat pie. Hopefully, they‚Äôll have them next time!

Purchased lunch for 2 ppl: The food was really great and I am picky about both my plaintain and chicken. The atmosphere was good atmosphere. The Mango drink was good also.  The pricing was reasonable considering the taste and portion size. The service was ok neither bad or great, it was average. You can sit in or take out.  I would return.

Updating my review from 5 to 3 stars as of July 2025 - I‚Äôve been 2 more times since my initial review and each time the food has been soooo oily. My jollof was sitting in oil. Pictures as proof. I‚Äôm disappointed

Food was absolutely delicious! Legitimate smoky jollof and soft beef suya with half salmon. I like that I could do half and half of the proteins. Most West African restaurants in the area disappoint but this place exceeded my expectations. Flavors were nicely balanced no excessive maggi or salt.

I really like this establishment. I was first introduced to them in the parking lot of the Bowie Town Center. I had the spicy honey wings with jollof rice and plantains. It was immaculate!!! This occasion made me visit at least 2-3 other times.

On the 2nd or third time, I didn't really care for the wings because they were starting to get a little too big, and I like my wings on the smaller side. The rice is always great with the  sauce they provide and more than enough plantains. The last time I went, I got the lamb, and that was really good. I'll definitely return, but the area is kind of busy with traffic and not the easiest to get to when I'm commuting.

Post Update 6/29/25: I visited this establishment again for at least the 4th time. The side sauce that you eat with the rice was amazing! I should've gotten the jollof rice because the white rice was very mediocre. It was a little overcooked and not as fluffy and Shelly as the last couple of times when I had it. I ordered the half lamb, half chicken. The lamb was delicious and cooked to perfection. The chicken was just "ok," and I'll need to broil it at home to get it completely right.

I also found out that I had a free reward for an order of six chicken wings. The wings were fine but not up to par of where they were before. You can tell they were sitting because they were not as crispy when I visited previous times. Overall, the food was mostly good and suffice, so I'll rate my recent experience a 7.8/10. I'll be back but will not be rushing to return.

Also, as a side note, I was really hungry, so one of my pictures is clearly after I've begun eating, so take that Pic with a grain of salt, no pun intended.

I brought my friends along to dine in with me. I went with the rice and stew platter this time, since I had the jollof rice on my previous visit which was absolutely delicious. However, the stew tasted a bit bitter.

Unexpectedly, the owner or manager came over to our table asking for feedback. I was hesitant at first, but I eventually shared my honest thoughts about the stew. To my surprise, he immediately offered me a free plate of jollof rice and asked his staff to bring him a sample of the stew to taste for himself.

I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews, but this experience really stood out. I truly appreciate a restaurant that values its customers and takes their feedback seriously.

I‚Äôll definitely be back with more friends

Just a bit clear, food is really good especially the jollof rice! The service if you dine in is can improve.

I had the Beef kebab with plantains and the rice. It was okay. The chicken version tastes much better.

As to the service, we were seated and given the wrong menus (we arrived at eight and we‚Äôre given lunch menus, which only had a limited number of items.) after we were given the wrong menus by one of the . We waited about 10 to 15 minutes. No one came to take our order and we were the only ones on the second floor. I had to go downstairs and ask the proprietor and he gave me the right menu and then came to get our order after about five minutes.

He looked grumpy didn‚Äôt wanna be there and basically said they had none of the juices we wanted such as the ginger juice, which is very tasty.  I can understand that he may have had a bad day, but in a customer facing situation, you gotta put on your best face.

Like I said, we had the food before. It‚Äôs very very good but if you‚Äôre gonna dine in, don‚Äôt expect any great service. I understand this is a tin establishment, specializing in West African food.

My husband and I used to go to the shawarma place in this building so we decided to try the new place that opened up - BEST choice!! The food is phenomenal. Worth every cent and more. Staff was so kind and welcoming, too. On top of that, there's gorgeous West African wood carvings and textiles and other art to enjoy while you eat. We loved both dishes we tried, and I can't wait to come back to try the snapper next time we're in the area. Come do some food tourism in your own neighborhood and support a small business!

Great African food. Location is in a good spot and distance from a lot of things. It was a little confusing when we first got to the door, and went through the kitchen to get to the upstairs dining area. I would suggest signs or something so it‚Äôs less confusing other then that, food was really good no complaints

Very delicious food.  Durian took such good care of us.  We enjoyed the peanut butter soup, okra stew, fried plantains, jollof rice, and fish dish. Definitely try it out if you are looking for delicious West African food!

Was fortunate to see their tent at the Capital Harvest at the Plaza. We tried the chicken kebab salad and beef kebab. Everything was so flavorful and FRESH! The salad was delicious. Even the bread is really good! And their portions are generous- especially on the salad. I highly recommend!

The owner here and the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and welcoming. My husband and I tried FuFu for the first time and it was finger-licking good. Also, we tried the jollof rice with tilapia, which was tasty and very spicy. If you are seeking to try or want some good African food this is your spot! Thank you for serving us.

Ordered the grill fish with sauce and plantains, the extra large suya and a meat pie. The food tasted great, fast service, and the food was well packaged. Very satisfied and I‚Äôm a fan. I‚Äôll definitely order from them again!

Ladies, if you come in cute (which I already know yall do!), expect to be there for an additional 30mins. The owner is nice enough, but the staff will literally look you in your face without saying a word until you ask if you can be assisted. Last 4 times in ordered, I wasn't given the meats I wanted because they didn't have it.  No word, no "what can we substitute it for" just gave me whatever....and they wrap the plates with saran and aluminum so you won't know until you're ready to eat.
This review is specifically because we've been ordering less and less since the last situations.
Just wanted a tray of suya (dry and tough) and a tray of meat pie. Peep how raw the fillings are in pics. Plus a tray packed with rice and one piece of meat...times are hard, I know but $20 for oily rice and one goat meat thats literally skin and bone.

The jollof rice was very good, fried fish was okay. They also give you a lot of food for your money. However, the food is in buffet style trays that are not heated and exposed. The Guy serving the food was standing right over it. Restaurant also looks very dingy. I personally wouldn‚Äôt come back but since we drove far to try it, we decided to do so.

Ok.. I read the reviews before I went there an it seemed good but nahh the jollof rice is terrible.  They even gave me burnt rice, old food they probably cooked 2days ago and chopped big onions. Waste of money . I wish I didn't have to drive that far to get this food

With classic Ghanian dishes included and the vibe friendly enough for a good conversation, this establishment had many options for every dish on the menu such as vegan, beef, chicken, fish, goat, and oxtail, ranging from $22 to $25 as standard price points. The food here is very authentic and has been approved by many of my West African friends living in the DMV area.

My friends and I decided to order one kind of each dish along with one kind of each side so we can try a bit of each. The okra soup was a bit too spicy for my taste, but it contained a lot of flavor, which could be neutralized a bit by the fufu that I ordered. The peanut butter soup was very creamy and flavorful. The jollof was a bit plain, but since the spinach stew was flavorful, it was all good. The wings seemed like an outlier amongst everything else we had ordered, and they were a bit dry, but with two types of dipping sauces, they worked out just fine.

Even though there are so many West African restaurants within the DMV area, I find this establishment to be one of the most authentic ones. Since Ghanian food itself is already fire in general, one can't go wrong with coming here.

Great Ghanan food. The meat in the jolof rice was super tender and it was very flavorful. However, they are very understaffed and naturally struggle to cater when there is a big crowd. Nevertheless, the servers are very kind and sweet. They deserve a lot, admin should consider increasing servers for better service!

Appioo African Bar & Grill is a cozy spot with really good West African comfort food. The jollof rice, egusi soup, and grilled meats are flavorful and filling. The vibe is relaxed, the music adds a nice touch, and the staff is friendly. It‚Äôs a great place to enjoy a hearty meal and chill with good energy.

Me and me girls had a fabulous experience, our waitress was very friendly and patient with our ignorance with the menu. The mango ginger margarita that was recommended was amazing!! They ran with 2 waitresses that ran the entire establishment and hustled hard. There will be a wait for food but that‚Äôs how you know it‚Äôs fresh. Portions are huge and price is very reasonable. I highly recommend this restaurant. Be patient if they‚Äôre busy the flavor explosion is worth the wait.

I dined here earlier today to have some Ghanaian food. My friend recommended we go here after trying it himself.

The service here was genuinely some of the worst service I‚Äôve ever seen. The staff were rude and giving attitude the entire time we were there. They even served other customers‚Äô orders even though they arrived after us, which is what bothered me the most.

I was at least hoping the food would make up for the poor service. The food was okay, but nothing special compared to the other Ghanaian food in the DC area.

This is a shame because I heard great reviews about this place from multiple friends. It seems as though there may have been some bad changes.

If you‚Äôre looking for Ghanaian/West African cuisine in the DC area, I would strongly recommend you take your money far away from this place. It‚Äôs not worth it.

A happy hour date at Dukem was right on time! After a busy day of work and running errands, my wife and I settled on Ethiopian food for dinner and that‚Äôs when I remembered seeing Instagram advertisement and Google reviews for happy hour at Dukem so we decided to give it a go! The food was fresh, service was great and the establishment welcoming. Since the weather was nice, we decided to sit outside on the terrace area. We really enjoyed the special beef tibs, pieces so flavorful and tender, the sambusas, both the chicken and spinach. I ordered the Shiro and gomen, while my wife ordered the misir wot and alicha kik, awesome portion size for the price and shareable with the injera. While waiting on our order we had a chance to speak with one of the owners, Yodit, very sweet of her checking in on how the evening and service was going. We will definitely be back again and can‚Äôt wait to check out more of the menu. I recommend Dukem be your next DC Ethiopian restaurant to check out and also check out their happy hour specials.

The food came quickly and was quite excellent. I have never had Ethiopian food before this, but I will definitely be looking to come back. Our server BK took great care of my party of three and she gave us helpful recommendations as well.

I enjoyed eating here nice clean atmosphere with family vibes. Only complaint was I wish the food was spicier (i like very spicy African food) and a LITTLE more seasoned. üòä Shared a combination platter with 2 others and it was a decent portion for all of us. We were served by BK and she was very nice.

It was our first time eating Ethiopian and the food was very delicious! The dishes came quickly and the waitress was really kind and gave us good recommendations on what to order. The ambiente was pleasant and the music fire as well :)
The waitresses were very kind & attentive and seating was comfortable. The food was amazing - my first time eating Ethiopian food. 10/10 I‚Äôll definitely be back!

name: Skyline Cafe-Ethiopian Cuisine
vicinity: 3821 S George Mason Dr, Falls Church

reviews.text: The food here is great but the service is a complete hit or miss. I‚Äôve been here a few times now and while I enjoy eating the food here my last visit left me feeling scammed and disappointed. I was charged 2.5x the regular price for a plate of food and had a 20% tip automatically added to my total bill. I tipped an additional $20 thinking there wasn‚Äôt a tip already included. In my past visit this wasn‚Äôt included. Avoid the lady with the tattoos on her face, she tried to take my copy of the receipt while signing.
Decided to try a new Ethiopian restaurant & this place didn‚Äôt disappoint. Tasty dishes just wish the portions were more generous bc it was so yummy.

The food is wonderful, delicious and filling. One thing I would say is if you do not understand anything about the menu, call and ask. You can order food from this restaurant via UBER Eats. Contrary what some said in their review about this restaurant having mostly fish related food in their menu, that totally not true.

They serve beef and fish. Just choose clearly over the phone and in person their friendly staff are willing to help you get beef related food with Injera. They also serve raw meat too. If you want it medium, rare or well done make it clear to them.

There might be a language barrier depending on who is working or picks up your phone call. So speak slow and clearly. Please be advised, service can be slow sometimes.
Great food and service. I was there a week ago with my wife and went back a week later with one of my nephews. He definitely enjoyed the meal.
The place is very dark for a restaurant, that‚Äôs the only issue at this place. The waitresses are very nice, attentive and friendly. The food is also tasty. I recommend ‚ÄúBanatu‚Äù for 2 people.

Had an amazing experience at Sebseb Ethiopian Restaurant and Bar! The lamb tibs was absolutely delicious - tender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. The patio was gorgeous, adding to the overall ambiance.

The service was warm and welcoming. The coffee after the meal was the perfect touch - a lovely way to cap off a wonderful dining experience.

Highly recommend Sebseb for amazing cuisine and a lovely atmosphere. Can't wait to come back!

The food, staff, and atmosphere were amazing. We ordered sambusa, lamb tibs, and veggie deluxe combo. Plenty of food for four. Delicious and highly recommend! The chef came to check on us. Finished our meal with some delicious Ethiopian coffee.

This is the best veg Ethiopian food we‚Äôve had! Silky smooth injera, great flavors and not too spicy, some unusual things like beets and  green beans and parsley salad, four kinds of lentils, all delicious. We‚Äôve been to at least six different Ethiopian restaurants in four different states and this was the best.

I stopped in with a friend based on reviews I read on Yelp.  If you don‚Äôt know where to look, you might miss the place, but what a great find.  A quiet little spot with amazing food, a fun friendly welcoming vibe, and a staff that made us feel like family.  If you ever want a chill, happy spot for great Ethiopian food, please make the trip.

Excellent Ethiopian food and service! Our experience couldn't have been better. They happily accommodated our very picky daughter and gluten free diner as well. The veggie combo was delicious, and the lamb tibs and doro wat were some of the best around! Service was exceptional and the prices were good.

Popped in here after being disappointed by the African food place next door. Service was excellent and food was great!
Will definitely be back. The place was also nice.

Asefu‚Äôs Palace is nothing short of DIVINE!!!

The atmosphere is flush with iridescent floral accents and purple and gold seating that is regal in every word.

Mrs. Hannah is truly gifted in the kitchen and blessed with commodious hospitality. I had the opportunity to indulge in the Goden (Marinated short ribs saut√©ed with onions and jalape√±os served with injera) and I must say that there was not one bite that I did not like!!!

The short ribs were tender, juicy, and seasoned to perfection. Likewise, the flavor of the injera was balanced; not too tangy and the texture was soft to the touch and palate.

If you are every in DC, I implore you to visit this oasis of flavor and flare.
The food was great and the service was amazing. Come eat here!
Outstanding meal with wonderful service. They even got wind of my birthday and played a birthday song on a speaker, sang to me, and brought cake and a candle. Wonderful experience! A true hidden gem!
The food was so fabulous and the service was top notch. Highly recommend this to anyone for an amazing experience!

I've been here several times, it's a go to whenever we have family or friends visiting, as most of them have never had ethiopian food before. It's a great option for people with dietary restrictions (gluten, dairy, meat). We always get the veggie combo and then add 2 meat or fish dishes. There's plenty for 4 people.

Tried a new place tonight.  Love Ethiopian food and this place did not disappoint.  I saw that it got pretty good reviews, so it was worth the drive from my place in Fairfax.  Had a short chat with the owner who is very personable.  Love the boom box hanging next to his bar, he just put up a few cassette tapes from his hometown.

We ordered some food after work with my non Ethiopian friends. The portion was so small, the fish and the injera was so dry. It doesn't taste at all. I think they don't care. Thos is going to be my last take away order. I will never ever order again.

I order pasta with meat souce and it comes completely trashed it smells so bad and I ate the spaghetti and immediately had to run to the bathroom to vomit because the food smelled bad. Afterwards, I couldn‚Äôt even open the container again due to the odor. When I called the merchant to report this, he cursed at me, hung up the phone, and showed no professionalism or concern. He didn‚Äôt even apologize for the situation I was going through. His behavior was extremely rude, unprofessional, and dismissive. Not only was I served unsafe food that made me ill, but I was also treated with complete disrespect when I tried to address the problem.
This shows a clear lack of care for both customer health and customer service. No one should have to experience being insulted and ignored after reporting food that is clearly unfit to eat.i don‚Äôt recommend for anyone !

I was staying across the street and came in because of the good reviews. Great atmosphere with Ethiopian pop music from YouTube on the TVs and lots of people hanging out. Food was delicious and spicy. Fun fact: the owner brought the old boombox zip tied to the column next to the bar with him from Ethiopia years ago.

Stopped here while working a night shift for some takeout, and the service was exceptional. The woman behind the counter brought me water and we had a great conversation while I waited for the food.

When the to-go box came out it was quite literally bursting at the seams with injera, so she recommended I eat some before leaving.

The injera was fantastic, the ribs were flavorful, and the sides (I got string beans and split peas) were to die for. You can't go wrong.

I have never felt so at home while trying to get takeout. I can imagine the service is even better if you dine in.

I went to Ghion because I had never tried Ethiopian food and it was so so so good!! The chicken stew with injera was awesome, and the owners are super nice. I am now a huge fan of Ethiopian food and excited to try it again!

Had dinner here with friends on a Friday night. Had the 7 vege combo with juicy beef between 3 people. Friendly service, the beer was tasty, and the food was delicious. The best I have had. The spicy lentils, collard greens, and beef were just a few of the favourites. I wish I could find a place like this in New Zealand.

This place is amazing. Everyone needs to eat here right now.

I ordered beef jerky and spicy lentils, and instructed the man behind the counter to pick his choice of Ethiopian beers. He brought back St. George, which was delicious. The entire time, his demeanor was incredibly friendly and welcoming.

My meal did not disappoint. Portion size was generous, and included a side of injera. The food was served hot, and the quality was fantastic. I ordered a second beer.

The atmosphere was bright and welcoming, with exposed brick, checkered table cloths, and vibrant colors on the wall. The warmly lit bar area created a friendly and inclusive vibe.

Several times, the man checked on me to ensure I was enjoying my meal. I was enjoying myself and let him know it. He insisted I write this review, and the rest is history. Halfway through writing this review, he brought me another beer, and now I‚Äôm done writing this review. And that‚Äôs how my night has been going so far.
My favourite Ethiopian place to go to when in DC. Down to earth atmosphere. Very friendly owner and staff, great service, and food is wonderful and reasonably priced. Will be back (again).

name: Nazret Ethiopian Restaurant
vicinity: 3821 S George Mason Dr D, Falls Church

reviews.text: My cousin, husband, and I had dinner at Nazret last night, and it was some of the best Ethiopian food any of us have had! We started with sambusa and telba fitfit appetizers then shared a VIP platter. It was a lot of food for three, but we just couldn‚Äôt put it down! The atmosphere was so warm and welcoming too - the owner greeted us as soon as we stepped in and even treated us to some amazing teas. I highly recommend visiting Nazret!

All the food was fresh and delicious! We had sambusas, fitfit, and veggie platter, with ginger spice tea. The sambusas were fragrant and warm with beautifully crispy pastry. The fitfit was new to me and it was great! A cold injera salad with tomato onion and fresh jalapeno, it was very refreshing! The veggie platter had all the classics, spicy lentils, shiro, collards, yellow peas and more.  The injera was tangy and soft, and all the traditional vegetarian sides were well spiced and flavorful.

And our server Sololea was kind and friendly and took good care of us. Overall it was a great meal!

I was craving Ethiopian food and our meal hit the spot. We got an order of lentil sabusas (2) and enjoyed them, the dough was chewy and soft. We shared the vegetable special and some ribs on a large plate of injera. The vegetables were amazingly spiced, each with different flavors, and the meat was also delicious. The only critique I have is that practical joke YouTube videos were playing on the TVs - I am guessing that a customer requested them, but they were distracting and detracted from the atmosphere a bit. The music was lovely and the service and food was excellent, we will be back when we are in the area

We had the awesome Chef Mekonnen and the Nazret team cater our ~50 person wedding. My wife and I couldn't be happier with how things turned out. They were able to provide full support from a wonderful setup through bar support and went the extra mile to help clean after they had packed up their gear.

This is a lovely spot and I'd recommend not only dropping by for a meal, but trusting them with ANY event you could throw.

My friend and I went here randomly after going to a scent shop nearby. We ordered the veggie platter with lamb tibs. The customer service was great as well. All smiles and treated like family. Would love to come back.

Had such a great meal at Chercher Restaurant! The food was fresh, flavorful, and authentic, every bite was amazing. The staff were super friendly and made the experience even better. Definitely one of the best spots in town for Ethiopian food. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

The food is AMAZING. If you eat meat. I ordered a chicken dish‚Äîthe meat was so tender. The spice is more than just heat‚Äîit‚Äôs pure flavor. I ordered the chicken dish with a boiled egg, and the curry has just an unbelievable aroma to it. Love the texture of the injera (the spongy bread). The reason I rated it four is because I did feel like the vegan options fell a little short. There was ten sides offered in the vegan platter, but I felt that they were significantly less flavorful than the chicken dish. Overall, would 100% recommend if you‚Äôre looking to eat meat.

My family and I come here on a regular basis and the food never disappoints, we absolutely love this place! The vegan options are amazing, we always get the vegan delight delux, and the meat options are also great (my boyfriend loves them).
Amazing service and excellent food. We got the sambosa, the special tibs and the deluxe vegan combo. Everything was so good. Can't wait to come back again

I've had the opportunity to eat at the CherCher 9th St location, so My expectations were very high. The place has indoor and outdoor seating. The decorations are filled with fine art. The music has set the ambiance perfectly. I ordered the #LambTibs with #Injera. They were seasoned so well. The waiter was very nice and helpful. My Food came out quick and was hot. The bathroom was clean. I really smiled my experience.

name: Amie's African Kitchen & Grill
vicinity: 4515 Village Fair Dr Suite E4, Dallas

reviews.text: First time here. The egusi was spicy and good. But it tasted different than any other places I've been to. It was a lot darker as well, and no, i don't think it was because of the palm oil. Maybe it was overcooked, I don't know. It was still good to me. I'll definitely be back. I do wish they had prices on the pictures or a menu out with prices. I was charged more than the menu I say online. So that's my complaint. If you're in the area, check them out.

The food was good to the taste. My only concern was that as i was eating I noticed what felt like glass in the egusi and fufu. It was gritty like tiny shards of glass were in it, and i know thats not apart of the recipe. I understand people make mistakes, but next time please make sure you are being careful as your cooking the food.
I had the oxtail as well as the egusi soup with fufu. They were flavorful and the serving sizes were good.
Came from San Antonio stopped by this place and the food lived up to my expectations . Quick service , friendly and staff was nice. Coming back for that Egusi and Fufu!

I ordered two dishes mixed together and a side of rice if I known that, it was gonna be $30 just for a bowl of rice a bowl of egusi and lamb mixed together. I wouldn‚Äôt have gotten it, but it is good. That‚Äôs the only reason, but for $30, you‚Äôre gonna have to do better than that than just a little bowl and fufu

Our friends wanted to try something new for lunch and found 5 Senses Nigerian Fusion nearby on Google. We did not research enough and learned upon arrival that they were pickup or delivery only üòÖ ‚Äì¬†no dine-in.  Chef Lola was so patient with us, and gave great recommendations on family-style platters. We ordered the herbed jollof rice, grilled chicken leg quarters, peppered turkey flats, and a stewed spinach dish. Since our order was quite large, we did have to wait about half an hour, so chef treated us with 2 boxes of fresh puff puff! These were like bite-sized Nigerian beignets, dusted with nutmeg and cinnamon sugar, and had 2 dipping options of habanero+mango and a sweet creamy glaze-like sauce. So thoughtful, and really curbed our hanger. Once we brought the food home, I did not take a great picture, because the smell was so intoxicating that we all dug right in. Everyone was super impressed with how flavorful, soulful, and filling each dish was. We had a young picky eater with us, and she ate every bite! We can't wait to try more dishes!
Food was really good a bit too spicy for me. The bread was really fantastic and the service was excellent. I did take out! The pasta is delicious and chicken really tasty.

Refrain from visiting this establishment. While I was seated in my vehicle, I observed that the staff members were not wearing gloves, were consuming food while preparing my meal, and continued to touch my food after touching their mouths. The entire process took over 45 minutes to receive my order. Ultimately, I requested a refund, as it is unreasonable for food to take such an extended time for a single person.

The other reviews are giving friends/family of owner. Food is okay. I would recommend the puff puff and jollof spaghetti those taste similar to actual Nigerian food. However, they need to put salt and pepper üå∂Ô∏è in their food or somebody‚Äôs seasoning before calling it Nigerian anything.

This restaurant is serving out of the Prep Kitchen located in Dallas off Regal Row. This area is in need of better food options and I'm glad this restaurant decided to move in. I ordered the Chicken Jollof Rice bowl and was not disappointed.  The wait was about 10mins and I received and a text that my order was ready for pickup. The food tasted amazing. I work very close by so I will be back to try other menu items.
Been here a few times now and always reliable with satisfying my cravings. Nice workers. Good portions. Amazing flavors. Always love the Ethiopian YouTube music videos playing on the TV haha.

Had the fish cutlet and veggie combo. Definitely feels like home here. Loved the veggies felt refreshed and full. Will probably return to try the meat combo. Was nice to have a meal and watch the game on a Sunday.

Walk inside and past the convenience store to the back. On this trip I ordered their special kitfo. Previously I ordered the fish cutlet. Not my usual choices so it's hard to rate them based on other experiences. The fish cutlet was ok, bit they did let me know before hand the other fish dish is preferred.

I would say their special spinach kitfo is very good, but not better than special gomen kitfo I've had elsewhere. It is how ever more filling and comes with more spinach so you don't need to order a veggie option with it. I did order a side, but my date and I could not finish 1/3 of the food we ordered and we tried our best for maybe 45 minutes of digging in.

One thing I noticed is their injera is very thick and not as even as other places but tastes like it was made with healthier ingredients so I liked it. Just not it's not as spongy and consistent as a lot of other places. Not good or bad, just something I noticed.

Oh yea. And their water. 4 of 5. Had a bit of background taste. But barely. Our glasses were clean and yes their give you glass. Some places have dirty glasses or more more refreshing water, but im haply they are very clean here. More clean than most 4 and 5 star places, they will swear they have clean utensils, but still dirty looking. Smh, but not here.

What about the scenery. Nice. Not the best, maybe a 3.75/5 for interior and a 2/5 for the outside. It's next to autozone and a drugstore with many beggars and people lurking the lot. Makes you feel a bit uncomfortable, but not as uncomfortable as the top of international district. That area is much worse. Oh, and there is a lot of parking. Hard to find this good of parking I'm seattle.

Follows COVID-standards and is very clean. Very fragrant and yummy food. The beers came with chilled mugs and the veggie combo + fish lebled came with extra injera. Very fun atmosphere and friendly staff. We got some mitmita from the shop to take home too! 10/10 would come again.

I love this market! Always get my berbere, mitmita and kibbeh from here :)
The spices are super fresh and the prices are reasonable.

name: Union N Eritrean and Ethiopian bar and Restaurant

reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been a regular at this establishment, but my recent visits have left me quite frustrated. First and foremost, the noise level is consistently overwhelming. Every time I walk in, the music is blaring, making it difficult to enjoy my meal or have a conversation.

Additionally, I‚Äôve felt undervalued as a customer. On my last visit, I noticed a discrepancy between the menu prices and what I was charged. When I brought this to the attention of the staff, I was informed that the prices on the menu were outdated and that they would be updating them next week. This lack of transparency is concerning, especially since I often choose to spend my money here.

I truly hope the management takes these issues seriously!

Stopped here on my way home after a late night out. Was pleasantly surprised to find them not only open, but still serving a full menu up until 1:00am. It's not my favorite Ethiopian spot but definitely on the list due to their hours.

The food was 4,5 days old, need's to be fresh to be surved and also the services is very poor there was no one there, after we left 3 of us vomited. They don't even deserve   a rate if I could I will give them -1 worst Food, worst service.
The meat was very bad i think it was old meat in fridge , i wouldn't recommended this place anyone who want good food
Keiwot and veggie platter was so good was told to try this place out I wasn‚Äôt disappointed

I recently visited this Nigerian restaurant and overall had a good experience, though there were a few bumps along the way. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the music set a really nice vibe that made the evening enjoyable. The food itself was very good‚Ä¶full of flavor and definitely worth coming back for.

That said, the service was a bit confusing. The restaurant uses a self-service system, but it seemed to be missing some options that should have been available. We briefly spoke to a server, but they disappeared after a quick exchange, leaving us unsure of how to proceed. Eventually, I believe it was the bartender who ended up taking our order, and they were very kind and helpful, which I appreciated.

So while the start of the experience felt a little disorganized, the food and the overall atmosphere made up for it. With a few improvements to the service and ordering process, this place could be excellent.

Been here twice, and the food has been really good on both occasions.

The first time we had it in was in March. The ogbono and egusi had tripes and pomo in them, and we added extra proteins to the order for extra charge.

Next time was in May. (2 months apart)
I noticed the soups didn‚Äôt have tripes or cow skin in them, which is very okay with me since the chicken this time was bigger than the first time.

We also had the Jollof as take outs.

Overall, the food is really good, and it is worth eating here.

This place checks all the boxes of an African restaurant in a good way. Ordering is made simple with being able to order off your phone. So you can take your time going over the menu. They have an easily accessible sink to wash your hand, the music and set up help with the atmosphereüëåüèæ. We had Okra, fufu, chicken stew, plantain and jollof with goat meat. It took like 5-7 minutes after ordering and our food was out like all items. To top it off the food was really really good hand down authentic.

I am also happy to see more diverse restaurants popping up downtown than the usual places. This was my first West African restaurant in Seattle and it easily exceeded expectations. Wonderful service, incredible food and a large menu I can't wait to work my way through over the next few months. A must visit!

Came on a Friday lunch time, so pretty quiet. I just ordered the plantains and beans. Really quick and delicious spice. Super cute space, nice art, music, and atmosphere. Great place to meet people for lunch during the work day, will be bringing people here. Not cheap, but nothing in this area is.

only $23 for the massive plate!!! DELICIOUS!!
such a calm, beautifully decorated place, with diverse food. the meat is cooked so well. also try their meat with jerky in it (second picture) the texture is amazing
The food is amazing and there's so much variety in a plate! Filling, flavorful, and not expensive. We had a great time there and will be visiting again. Wonderful place :)

I am giving this such a high review because the pasta was AMAZING!!!! But the other food was definitely cooked in a rush and not cooked over many hours. The injera was quite dry and thin. The atmosphere was awkward as it was completely empty. The service was kind, but the food took forever to come out which really pushed me to think that it was definitely made last minute and not spent cooking and stewing through the day. I will definitely be back for the pasta though. The price was okay but for the small amount of meat in the pasta it was a bit expensive, but so good that I will be back.
Very tasty! First time having Ethiopian food. Would return again.

I'm normally never out this way, and the two restaurants besides this one we're closed at the time. So what the hell, let's try something new!! The people outside and inside looked like they were enjoying themselves. So you order at the front counter your food and drinks. Take your number they give you to a table of your preference and wait. The ambiance of this place is super cool. One part of the restaurant is like a bike shop, if I remember correctly. It didn't take long for my Kimchi Bloody Mary to show up. Yes it sounds weird but it was damn good!!!! As some may know I love a good BLT!! This is not your regular smegular BLT. Wow of wow was it fresh and delicious. I finished that plate like I was starving!! I wanted another bloody Mary but I was driving home, so no bueno!! And don't be lazy put your own dishes away! Oh well til next time. Oh yes the bathrooms are clean
Delicious spiced tea, a prodigious veggie combo platter, and natural lighting with jazzy tunes to boot. Love the gluten free teff options
These best Ethiopian food I have ever had, simply delicious üòã 10/10 a must try. This was my first time trying Ethiopian Latte so good.
Great food. Friendly staff. Great prices. Can‚Äôt find better Ethiopian in Seattle.
The food is delicious, the restaurant is spacious and well-lit, and the vibe is kind.

The food was good and I spent the third time visiting Ethiopian style cuisine and the restaurant food and ambiance was good.
The spicy level was medium and I loved it.
The only concern was that it took time to serve the order and taste wise no concerns on that.

Blue Nile Ethiopian Restaurant is hands down one of the best dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. The flavors are authentic, rich, and unforgettable ‚Äî every bite feels like a celebration of Ethiopian culture. The food is simply top-tier.

Open late, felt super authentic, and was absolutely fantastic. I got the veggie platter (to go) & had intended to save some for leftovers but it was so delicious none made it to the fridge. Really fun atmosphere and everybody inside (diners and staff) were so friendly. Would love to go again next time we‚Äôre in Seattle!
The food was so delicious! My boyfriend and I split the Blue Nile and it was a great combination of veggie and meat.

Didn‚Äôt really like the setting inside. There was grass on the floor and tables weren‚Äôt clean. The food was okayish. Service was good. But I wouldn‚Äôt visit this place again. There are better Ethiopian restaurants.
Hana and zee were amazing. Kind service and delicious food! Authentic and fluffy injera

This was my first time trying Ethiopian food, and I am so glad I came to Zagol. My friend‚Äôs family member, who is from Eritrea, told me I would love it and they were right. The place was cozy, the server was kind and welcoming, and the food was absolutely delicious.

I do not remember the name of the dish, but it was full of flavor and beautifully presented. I loved learning to eat with my hands and sharing from the same plate. The injera bread was amazing, soft, and perfect for the experience.

Zagol made my first time unforgettable. I will definitely come back every time I visit Seattle.

Zero star. This was one of the worst dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. First of all, we found a stone in our food ‚Äî yes, an actual stone.  But it gets worse. The waiter completely ignored us the entire time ‚Äî not a single check-in, no apology, nothing. We sat there for 45 minutes waiting for food that showed up cold, stale, and clearly not fresh. The staff couldn‚Äôt care less, and the whole interaction felt like we were an inconvenience to them. No warmth, no accountability, just pure indifference. Absolutely disgraceful. Never, ever go to this place.

Extremely disappointing experience. The waiter barely acknowledged our table, no service, no water refills the entire time. After a 45-minute wait, we were served stale food. Worst part: I found a stone in my dish and nearly broke a tooth. Completely unacceptable. Will not be returning.
Great food and the sever was nice, I really liked their shiro the most, their misir wot was just okay but overall I loved the veggie combo.
We tried and enjoyed the meat combo plate and doro wat. Unfortunately, they were not serving Ethiopian coffee at the time.
Our favorite eithopian place in Seattle. I love that the meat can come spicy. Great portions and just amazing. I can't wait to try more things.

I can confidently say that this is the best Ethiopian restaurant in Seattle. I have been visiting for a long time, and over the last four years, the food quality, atmosphere, and service have remained unchanged‚Ä¶ the consistency is amazing. Each dish bursts with authentic flavors that transport me straight to back Home, and the injera is always perfectly soft and tangy. The staff greets you like family, making every visit feel like a warm reunion. Even during busy hours, they manage to maintain a level of attentiveness that is hard to find elsewhere. I often recommend this gem to friends, and they always leave raving about their experience.

Absolutely the best Ethiopian restaurant in town! The food at Agelgil is always fresh, flavorful, and truly authentic. It‚Äôs always delicious and has the same amazing taste every time . I really appreciate their consistency. and every dish is full of that amazing homemade taste. The staff go above and beyond to make you feel welcome and happy, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. You can truly tell they put their heart into everything they do.

Highly recommend Agelgil to anyone who loves great Ethiopian food!
Delicious Ethiopian food! Loved the greens in the meat combo and very large portions, but I do wish the injera was a bit warmer.

Let me tell you something: I walked into this Ethiopian restaurant a mere mortal and walked out spiritually reborn, smelling faintly of berbere and happiness.

Every bite was like a warm hug.  The lentils? Seasoned perfectly. The meat, tender as Jason Segel‚Äôs heart in forgetting Sarah Marshall.

And don‚Äôt even get me started on the service, these people don‚Äôt just serve food, they curate experiences.
Africanita! The best of the best in Seattle. I was very happy to shop at the store. And I appreciate the welcome from the staff.
Good place to be friendly and very kind they speak so many languages I love it I would like to go again
This was my first experience and Horrible customer service. No welcome at all the lady was on the phone all the time. Ask a question where products are just point and look you up and down.
Very friendly customer service!!
Unique selection and friendly üòÅ

First of all, the food was AMAZING. It had just the right flavors and it tasted so hand-made which I love. For the price, we were fed SO much. They kept refilling our anjeer bread and we had plenty of leftovers left. The service was super nice. I loved this place. Lots of vegetarian options too. 10/10 recommend.

I had a strong appetite for Eastern African cuisine and searched somewhere in the Seattle area with good ratings. My husband and I got lucky that the day we checked out this restaurant, they were celebrating a family activity. It was very endearing how they welcomed and serviced us, even bringing us cake from their celebration.

It felt aesthetically unassuming and their customer service was very attentive and sweet. We appreciated their help when going over the menu and selecting the right options. We went with a softer textured meat (can‚Äôt remember the name of the plate) and the Veggie Combo.

My husband cannot eat very spicy food, so finding less spicy food options can be a bit tricky. For example, please note that the salad comes with jalape√±os. This would have been good to know in advance since we did not expect that.

They have a section with a pool table. Again, quite modest in aesthetic but it looks like it is a family-friendly option where they put on their own celebratory events.

Very worth a try.

Unfortunately not the best. I used to come here a lot when Chef owned the establishment so maybe my expectations were higher than they should have been.
